parameterdescription.para: expression to be evaluated

briefdescription.para: Delay for the specified number of micro seconds.

parameterdescription.para: Blocking delay in micro seconds

briefdescription.para: opens, optionally takes control and optionally initializes an peripheral channel

parameterdescription.para: Application specific peripheral channel identifier
Application specific flags for stream initialization

simplesect.para: A peripheral channel can be define by its communication protocole (Modbus_COM1, BACnet_COM1, etc) or by target external device driver (PCA9555_1, M24C32_1, etc) This is a good place to add RTOS support for mutex or initialize low level layer. eMpb_Open should be called for multiple consecutive access algorithm along with eMpb_Close.

briefdescription.para: closes, optionnaly releases control and optionally deinitializes peripheral channel

parameterdescription.para: Application specific peripheral channel identifier

simplesect.para: This is a good place to add RTOS support for mutex. eMpb_Open should be called for multiple consecutive access algorithm along with eMpb_Close.

parameterdescription.para: Application specific peripheral channel identifier
Size in bytes of Memory Address or Device Command sent at the beginning of transaction. Can be 0.
Pointer to address or command buffer sent. NULL if xAddrCmdSize = 0, else not NULL.

Number of bytes to be read
Pointer where to save number of bytes read. Can be NULL.
